title.narrative: Strengthening The Health System In Jimma Zone

description.narrative:
General Objective: “Improved availability and accessibility of good quality healthcare at primary and secondary level in the Jimma Zone (Oromia Region, Ethiopia), and a stronger health system at large, which supports the progressive realization of Universal Health Coverage (SDG 3.8) in this geographical area.”
The three (inter-related) targeted Outcomes are:
1. Improved Health Service Delivery in 13 woredas of the Jimma Zone, reflected in: A. Increased utilization of good quality services B. Increased equity in access
2. Improved governance of health service delivery through: A. Increased capacity of 13 Woreda Health Offices and 1 Zonal Health Department B. Institutionalisation of PBF in the Ethiopian health system
3. An enhanced health information system that supports: A. Data based decision making at Woreda, Zonal and Regional level B. Additional financing potential for health system through enhanced transparency

In Ethiopia, Cordaid started to showcase Performance Based Financing in the arid and pastoralist Borana zone of the Oromia region since May 1st, 2015. At first in 4 Borana districts and with 9 Health facilities but as of July 2018 scaling it up to 8 Borana districts with in total 25 Health facilities with a catchment population of 488,556. Both PBF Borana phases are supported by Cordaid funds.
Halfway 2018 Cordaid was invited by the Netherlands Embassy to formulate a four year proposal and budget for scaling up PBF in the rural coffee growing zone of Jimma. Early April 2019 the Embassy approved the four year project proposal using as starting date the 1st of April 2019. During the first six months the project will be set up and staff recruited and trained. The first quarter for which the health facilities will be contracted under PBF will be October to December 2019.

The project will focus on 13 Jimma zone districts (of the in total 21 Jimma districts). It will work mostly via health facilities. In total 65 Health Centers and 5 Hospitals will be contracted under the PBF project. In total these facilities have a catchment population of 1.828.148 people living in the 13 targeted districts of the Jimma zone.

title.narrative: Climate Resilience
The project integrates climate risks in programming

description.narrative: The integration of climate risks in programming includes an undertaking of concrete actions to reduce and/or mitigate risks related to climate change impact and disaster risks ( for example droughts, erosion, salinization, flooding, etc.) The projects we refer to could be on the themes of health education, justice, security, disaster management, finance and livelihoods.
